The house of #Manipur BJP Minority Morcha president Mohd Asker Ali was set on fire by an irate mob on Sunday night allegedly for supporting the Waqf Amendment Bill. The incident happened at Lilong in Thoubal district.

Facing backlash from his community, the Meitei-Pangal (Manipuri Muslim) leader later posted a video on Facebook apologizing for his stance and retracting his support.

#WaqfAmendmentBill #WaqfBoard  #WaqfBill #IndiaTodayNE

tweets.text:
A unified national portal for waqf records is one of the Bill‚Äôs most forward-looking reforms. It will simplify access, improve tracking, and reduce mismanagement of religious endowments. This digital step supports better transparency and helps individuals, communities, and institutions understand the waqf system clearly. When combined with standardized waqf deeds and structured appeals, the portal creates a more open, user-friendly process. It marks a step toward modernization while keeping the waqf system rooted in its traditional purpose and spirit.
#WaqfAmendmentBill

tweets.text:
The Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025 is a game-changer for transparency and equality. For the first time, women‚Äîincluding those from Bohra and Aghakhani sects‚Äîget their rightful share in Waqf inheritance. Additionally, the amendment introduces a centralized digital portal for waqf records, ending decades of shadowy registrations. It reclaims wrongly claimed heritage sites, bars Waqf creation on tribal land, and restructures Waqf Boards to include MPs, judges, and even non-Muslims. This is not just reform‚Äîit‚Äôs reclamation. Reclamation of justice, of public land, and of the very idea that religious administration must also abide by democratic checks and balances.
#WaqfAmendmentBill

tweets.text:
The 2025 Waqf Bill bridges the gap between old customs and today‚Äôs legal needs. With digital reforms, clear documentation, and extended appeal processes, the law embraces modern tools without losing its cultural foundation. It ensures that waqf properties continue to serve communities as originally intended‚Äîthrough structured, accountable management. These changes aim to prevent misuse and ensure sustainability. By combining heritage with technology and fairness, the Bill reflects a thoughtful evolution of an important religious and social institution.
#WaqfAmendmentBill

tweets.text:
The Parliament of India has passed a law titled the Muslim Waqf (Amendment) Bill 2025. Upon analyzing the various provisions of this legislation, we have observed that it appears to undermine the rights of India‚Äôs minority Muslim community and attempts to foster discriminatory practices. India is a vast democratic nation. In such a large democratic state, it is the responsibility of the government to uphold its role as a guardian in protecting the religious rights of citizens of all faiths. We express our hope that the Government of India will reconsider this law in light of this principle. We believe that this step will play a historic role in maintaining regional communal harmony.
‚Äî
Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP)
April 6, 2025
Press conference by Mr. Salahuddin Ahmed, Member of the National Standing Committee of the BNP.
#Bangladesh #BNP #SaveWaqf
